column2: Maren, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Doctors wrote in my chart Pamelor instead of Panlor SS.  Be careful please.

column2: gary4sunshine, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have Peripheral Neuropathy,HypoThyroidism & Degenerative Disc/Joint Disease. 3 surgeries with no relief from pain. My Neurologist wants me off Percocet(which was working somewhat) because the DEA is cracking down? But after 3rd day on Panlor SS, the pain was unbearable, so I'm taking 1 1/2 tablets every 8 hrs now, which is helping, but I'm pretty fatigued. Probably going back to Percocet.

column2: Sad, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: azzie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: i have been taking panlor for about 6 years. to prevent migraines, my dosage is 4 a day. it has been extremely effective, however, without it, i experience severe withdrawal symptoms. i am easily agitated and my migraines are far worse. this drug can be addictive. if you are being treated with this drug or plan to, all i can recommend is to make sure you have your re-fills in order.

column2: BPStewart, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I FELL A HIT MY BUSTED MY HEAD OPED ON CONCRETE AND HAD A SEVERE HEAD INJURY AND IT WAS THE ONLY THING I COULD TAKE WITH MY SLEEPING MEDICINE AND ANXIETY MEDICINE THAT WOULD TAKE SOME OF THE PAIN AWAY AFTER HITTING MY HEAD SO SEVERELY, IM AM FULL TIME COLLEGE STUDENT I STILL HAVE TO BE ABLE TO FUNCTION EVERY DAY. I STILL HAVE PAIN EVEN ON THEM BUT IT HELPS SOME. I WISH THEY WOULD MAKE THE SIZE OF THE PILLS SMALLER HOWEVER.

column2: Painfree, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have chronic headaches and migrane headaches.  This is the only medication that stops the pain and allows me to function at the same time.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with migraines for over 36 years.  I have been on all medications.  Finally, a doctor gave me this medication to take for breakthrough migraines.  This is the only medication that will stop the migraines in their tracks.  Now I no longer have to go get shots when I get bad bad migraines that my regular medication does not stop.  This is the best medication I would recommend for migraines.   I can still focus, and function.  Only negative impact is I get a little sluggish but it stops the migraine and that is so worth it.

column2: TVG, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Back pain.Had been rx lorcet/lortab...the usual hydro/apap combinations and they couldn't touch the pain level without giving me , either a high sensation or "buzz".  This product actually did what my dr. said it would! Took care of my pain and i wasn't all mentally cloudy!
